{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2505.03408v1", "title": "The raspberries in three dimensions with at most two sizes of berry", "summary": "In three dimensional Euclidean space, a raspberry is defined to be an
arrangement of spheres with pairwise disjoint interiors, where all spheres are
tangent to a central unit sphere and such that the contact graph of the
non-central spheres triangulates the central sphere.
  We discuss the relevance of these structures in related work. We present a
catalog of all configurations of radii that permit the formation of raspberries
that have at most two sizes of non-central spheres. Throughout, we discuss the
construction of this catalog.", "main_category": "math.MG", "categories": "math.MG", "published": "2025-05-06T10:35:09Z"}
